analysis.title: Seven Pounds
analysis.author: Grant Nieporte

assessment.recommendation_rationale: Strong weighted score of 7.30, excellent concept (8), strong protagonist (8), high CVS (16), and perfect fit for Latin American market. Despite some structural issues, the emotional power and commercial appeal warrant recommendation.

film_now_assessment.lightning_test: Strong hook with suicide call in first page, but lacks immediate visceral grab
goosebumps_moments: Page 113-114: Final scene with Ezra seeing through Tim's eyes
film_now_assessment.career_risk_test: Strong project but not career-defining - good commercial and artistic potential
film_now_assessment.legacy_potential: Could be remembered as solid Will Smith-type vehicle but unlikely to be classic
disqualifying_factors: Not transcendent enough for FILM NOW

analysis.verdict_statement: SEVEN POUNDS is a compelling redemption drama with a unique premise and strong emotional core that would work well for Latin American audiences. While it has some structural issues in the middle section, the powerful concept and excellent star vehicle role make it a solid commercial prospect worth developing.
analysis.executive_summary: Emotionally powerful redemption drama with unique premise and strong commercial appeal. Perfect star vehicle with universal themes. Some development needed but strong recommendation for production.
